page.title: 15LOCAL PERSON - REDHILL
page.content: {Mr. Hatt}moved to{Redhill}in{l924, when he was 7 years old. He now lives at 80, Wray Park Road. He went to St. Matthew's School until he was l4 years old & remembers milk & coal being delivered to the local houses by horse & cart, & fire engines also being pulled by horses. Reigate & Redhill were {very quiet } in those days. Many of the big houses still survive today but have been converted into flats. Mr. Hatt can remember eating more porridge, fried bread & fresh vegetables as a boy. During the{Second World War,}Mr. Hatt was away fighting but he can remember being home on leave when the soldiers returned from Dunkirk. He told us about the bomb which fell at Shaws Corner causing much damage. He says fun as a family was better as there were less distractions.
